definitions: seafaring Scandinavian warrior and trader from the 8th to 11th centuries
person who embodies fierce warrior qualities or aggressive exploration
examples: The Vikings sailed across the North Atlantic to reach Iceland
Archaeological evidence shows Vikings established settlements throughout Europe
He approached business deals like a Viking conquering new territory
The team played with Viking intensity during the championship match

definitions: large elegant house with grounds, typically in the countryside or resort area
country house of wealthy ancient Romans with farms and gardens
examples: They rented a villa in Tuscany for their summer vacation
The coastal villa featured panoramic ocean views and private beach access
Archaeologists excavated a Roman villa complete with mosaic floors
The villa's remains showed sophisticated heating and plumbing systems

definitions: small community of houses and buildings in a rural area, smaller than a town
examples: The village had only one general store and post office
Children walked through the village to reach the local school
The entire village gathered for the annual harvest festival
Many young people leave the village seeking opportunities in cities

definitions: bowed string instrument slightly larger than a violin with a deeper tone
genus of flowering plants including violets and pansies with five petals
examples: The viola section provides rich harmonies in the orchestra
She switched from violin to viola for its warmer sound
Purple violas bloomed throughout the garden in early spring
The gardener planted violas along the border for continuous color

definitions: ancient Roman poet who wrote the Aeneid epic, considered one of Rome's greatest literary figures
examples: Students studied Virgil's Aeneid in their Latin literature class
Virgil influenced centuries of European poetry and epic writing
Dante chose Virgil as his guide through Hell in the Divine Comedy
The museum displayed rare manuscripts of Virgil's pastoral poems

definitions: person who has never engaged in sexual intercourse
something in its original untouched or unspoiled state
examples: Medieval society placed high value on remaining a virgin until marriage
The couple decided to remain virgins until their wedding night
They explored virgin forests never logged by humans
The artist worked with virgin canvas untreated by primer

definitions: state in the southeastern United States, one of the original thirteen colonies
female given name of Latin origin meaning maiden or virgin
examples: Virginia was crucial in the American Revolution and Civil War
They moved to Virginia to work in the technology sector
Virginia Woolf revolutionized modernist literature with her novels
My grandmother Virginia lived through the Great Depression

definitions: person who lives in or comes from the state of Virginia
examples: As a proud Virginian, she knew all the state's historical sites
Many Virginians work in government jobs near Washington DC
The Virginian delegation played a key role in the Constitutional Convention
Famous Virginians include several founding fathers and presidents

definitions: sixth astrological sign in the zodiac associated with those born August 23 to September 22
large constellation on the celestial equator representing a maiden
examples: As a Virgo, she was known for attention to detail
Virgos are often described as practical and analytical personalities
The constellation Virgo contains the bright star Spica
Astronomers study galaxies located within the Virgo cluster

definitions: major Hindu god who preserves and protects the universe, part of the Hindu trinity
examples: Devotees worship Vishnu as the supreme being in Vaishnavism
The temple featured elaborate carvings depicting Vishnu's ten avatars
Vishnu appears in many forms including Krishna and Rama
Ancient texts describe Vishnu resting on the cosmic serpent

definitions: member of the western branch of Gothic peoples who invaded the Roman Empire and ruled Spain
examples: The Visigoths established a kingdom in Spain lasting until 711 AD
Visigoth warriors adopted many Roman military practices
Archaeological sites reveal Visigoth art combining Germanic and Roman styles
The Visigoth legal code influenced medieval Spanish law

definitions: longest river in Poland flowing northward through Warsaw to the Baltic Sea
examples: The Vistula divides Warsaw into two distinct parts
Barges transport goods along the Vistula to Baltic ports
Medieval traders used the Vistula as a major commercial route
The battle at the Vistula proved decisive in Polish history

definitions: Italian baroque composer and violinist best known for The Four Seasons concertos
examples: The orchestra performed Vivaldi's Four Seasons to a packed audience
Vivaldi composed over 500 concertos during his prolific career
Music students study Vivaldi's innovative violin techniques
The festival featured all of Vivaldi's known opera works

definitions: major Pacific port city in far eastern Russia near the borders with China and North Korea
examples: The Trans-Siberian Railway terminates in Vladivostok after crossing Russia
Vladivostok serves as Russia's principal Pacific naval base
Ships from Vladivostok carry cargo throughout the Pacific region
Winter temperatures in Vladivostok drop well below freezing

definitions: longest river in Europe flowing through central Russia to the Caspian Sea
examples: The Volga has been called Mother Volga in Russian culture
Hydroelectric dams along the Volga generate significant power
Cruise ships carry tourists along the scenic Volga route
The Volga delta supports diverse wildlife and fishing industries

definitions: major Russian city on the Volga River, formerly known as Stalingrad
examples: Volgograd was rebuilt after devastating destruction in World War II
The city of Volgograd stretches along the western bank of the Volga
Tourists visit Volgograd to see the famous Motherland Calls statue
Volgograd remains an important industrial and transportation center

definitions: Italian physicist who invented the electric battery and gave his name to the volt
river system in West Africa flowing through Ghana to the Atlantic Ocean
examples: Alessandro Volta demonstrated the first battery to Napoleon in 1801
The volt unit of electrical potential honors Volta's contributions
The Volta River was dammed to create Lake Volta
Fishing communities depend on the Volta for their livelihood

definitions: relating to electricity produced by chemical action as in a battery
examples: The voltaic pile was the first source of continuous electric current
Scientists studied voltaic cells to understand electrochemical reactions
Voltaic systems convert chemical energy directly into electrical energy
The experiment demonstrated basic principles of voltaic electricity

definitions: French Enlightenment writer and philosopher known for wit, criticism of Christianity, and advocacy of freedom
examples: Voltaire's Candide satirizes philosophical optimism through dark humor
The quote about defending free speech is often attributed to Voltaire
Students read Voltaire to understand Enlightenment thinking
Voltaire corresponded with rulers and intellectuals across Europe

definitions: person who freely offers to do something without being paid or forced
person who freely enlists for military service rather than being drafted
examples: The hospital relies on volunteers to assist patients and families
She volunteers at the animal shelter every weekend
Many volunteers enlisted after the attack on Pearl Harbor
The army consisted entirely of volunteers rather than conscripts

definitions: Roman god of fire and metalworking, equivalent to Greek Hephaestus
fictional home planet of Spock and the logical Vulcan species in Star Trek
examples: Romans prayed to Vulcan to prevent destructive fires
The temple of Vulcan stood near the Roman Forum
Spock struggled between his Vulcan logic and human emotions
The planet Vulcan was destroyed in the alternate timeline

definitions: late 4th-century Latin translation of the Bible that became the Catholic Church's official version
examples: Medieval monks copied the Vulgate by hand in monastery scriptoriums
The Vulgate influenced European languages through religious vocabulary
Scholars compare the Vulgate with Greek and Hebrew texts
The Council of Trent affirmed the Vulgate's authority

definitions: wide area network connecting computers across large geographical distances
examples: The company's WAN links offices across multiple continents
WAN optimization improves data transfer between distant locations
Internet service providers maintain extensive WAN infrastructure
The WAN connection failed, isolating the branch office

definitions: flying insect with a narrow waist and painful sting, related to bees
White Anglo-Saxon Protestant, referring to privileged American demographic group
examples: The wasp built its paper nest under the roof eaves
A wasp sting can cause severe allergic reactions in some people
The country club had a reputation as a WASP enclave
WASP culture dominated American institutions for generations

definitions: white blood cells that fight infection and disease in the immune system
World Boxing Council, one of four major organizations sanctioning professional boxing
examples: The doctor ordered a WBC count to check for infection
Elevated WBC levels often indicate the body is fighting illness
The fighter won the WBC heavyweight championship belt
WBC rankings determine mandatory title challengers

definitions: person regarded as weak, cowardly, or lacking confidence and determination
examples: Don't be such a wimp about getting the injection
His classmates called him a wimp for avoiding confrontation
She proved she wasn't a wimp by completing the marathon
The coach said wimps don't make the varsity team

definitions: wireless local area network allowing devices to connect without physical cables
examples: The office WLAN provides internet access throughout the building
Configure your device to connect to the secure WLAN
WLAN technology enables mobility within the coverage area
The hotel's WLAN required a password for guest access

definitions: weapons of mass destruction including nuclear, chemical, and biological weapons
examples: International inspectors searched for WMD in Iraq
Treaties aim to prevent the proliferation of WMD
The threat of WMD shapes modern security policies
Nations stockpile WMD as strategic deterrents

definitions: World Meteorological Organization coordinating global weather and climate observations
examples: The WMO issues warnings about extreme weather events
WMO standards ensure consistent weather data worldwide
Climate scientists collaborate through WMO research programs
The WMO monitors greenhouse gas concentrations globally

definitions: west-southwest, the compass point midway between west and southwest
examples: The wind blew from the WSW at fifteen knots
Set course WSW to reach the next port
The storm approached from the WSW quadrant
WSW exposure provides afternoon shade in summer

definitions: World Trade Center, particularly the twin towers destroyed in the September 11 attacks
examples: The WTC towers dominated Manhattan's skyline until 2001
Many businesses had offices in the WTC complex
The WTC memorial honors victims of the terrorist attacks
Rebuilding the WTC site took over a decade

definitions: World Trade Organization regulating international trade between nations
examples: The WTO resolves trade disputes between member countries
China joined the WTO in 2001 after lengthy negotiations
WTO rules govern tariffs and trade barriers
Developing nations seek better representation in WTO decisions

definitions: World Wide Web, the system of interlinked hypertext documents accessed via the internet
examples: Type www before the domain name to access the website
The WWW revolutionized how people share and access information
Tim Berners-Lee invented the WWW at CERN in 1989
Most URLs begin with www though it's often optional

definitions: 19th-century German composer known for epic operas and revolutionary harmonic language
examples: Wagner's Ring Cycle takes four nights to perform completely
The festival in Bayreuth exclusively performs Wagner's operas
Wagner's music dramas influenced modern film scoring techniques
Critics debated Wagner's anti-Semitic writings and their impact

definitions: relating to or characteristic of Wagner's music, especially its grand dramatic scale
examples: The film's Wagnerian score emphasized epic battle scenes
She possessed a powerful Wagnerian soprano voice
The production took a Wagnerian approach with elaborate sets
Critics described the lengthy speech as positively Wagnerian

definitions: four-wheeled vehicle pulled by horses or oxen for transporting goods
railway freight car or passenger car used on trains
examples: Pioneers crossed the prairie in covered wagons
The farmer loaded hay onto the wagon
The freight wagon carried coal to the power plant
Children played in an old red wagon

definitions: follower of Wahhabism, an austere form of Sunni Islam dominant in Saudi Arabia
examples: Wahhabi clerics influence Saudi religious and social policies
The Wahhabi interpretation rejects many traditional Islamic practices
Wahhabi missionaries spread their doctrine throughout the Muslim world
Critics argue Wahhabi ideology promotes religious intolerance

definitions: conservative Islamic doctrine and religious movement founded in 18th-century Arabia emphasizing literal interpretation
examples: Wahhabism shapes the legal system in Saudi Arabia
The spread of Wahhabism concerns moderate Muslim leaders
Wahhabism rejects practices it considers innovations to Islam
Oil wealth enabled global promotion of Wahhabism

definitions: large open farm wagon for carrying loads, especially hay or grain
alternative name for the constellation Ursa Major or the Big Dipper
examples: The harvest wain creaked under its heavy load
Medieval peasants used wains to transport crops
Charles's Wain circles around the North Star
Sailors navigated using Charles's Wain constellation

definitions: gathering held before or after a funeral to mourn the deceased
trail of disturbed water left by a moving ship or boat
aftermath or consequences following an event or action
examples: Family and friends gathered at the wake to share memories
The Irish wake included storytelling and traditional music
The speedboat left a foaming wake across the lake
Dolphins played in the ship's wake
In the wake of the scandal, several officials resigned
Rebuilding began in the wake of the hurricane

definitions: hall in Norse mythology where warriors slain in battle feast with Odin, also spelled Valhalla
examples: Vikings believed brave warriors entered Walhalla after death
The opera depicts heroes feasting in Walhalla
Wagner's opera house was nicknamed the Walhalla of music
They called the mountain lodge their personal Walhalla

definitions: person who walks, especially for exercise or as a regular activity
frame device that helps elderly or disabled people walk safely
examples: Early morning walkers filled the park paths
She's a fast walker who covers five miles daily
His grandmother uses a walker since her hip surgery
The physical therapist adjusted the walker's height

definitions: portable cassette or CD player with headphones, originally a Sony brand name
examples: His Walkman revolutionized how people listened to music
She jogged with her Walkman playing motivational songs
The original Walkman used cassette tapes before CD versions
Collectors seek vintage Walkman models from the 1980s

definitions: French-speaking people of southern Belgium and adjacent areas
Romance language or dialect spoken by Walloons in Belgium
examples: Walloons comprise about one-third of Belgium's population
The Walloon region has its own parliament and government
Few people still speak traditional Walloon at home
Walloon differs significantly from standard French

definitions: Native American people from present-day Massachusetts and Rhode Island who helped the Pilgrims
examples: The Wampanoag taught Pilgrims how to cultivate corn
Wampanoag tribes still maintain their cultural traditions today
The treaty between Pilgrims and Wampanoag lasted fifty years
Wampanoag language revival programs teach children their heritage

definitions: separate room or division in a hospital for particular patients
person, especially a child, under legal protection of a guardian
administrative division of a city or town for electoral purposes
examples: The nurse worked in the pediatric ward
The psychiatric ward required special security measures
The court appointed her as ward of the state
His wealthy uncle's ward inherited the entire estate
She represents the third ward on city council
Each ward elects two representatives

definitions: American artist who led the pop art movement with works featuring commercial and celebrity images
examples: Warhol's Campbell's Soup Cans challenged traditional art concepts
The Warhol museum in Pittsburgh displays his diverse works
Warhol famously said everyone would have fifteen minutes of fame
Celebrities gathered at Warhol's Factory studio in New York

definitions: network of interconnecting rabbit burrows and tunnels
densely populated or labyrinthine area of buildings or streets
common surname, notably of politician Elizabeth Warren
examples: The rabbit warren extended beneath the entire hillside
Hunters used ferrets to flush rabbits from the warren
The old town was a warren of narrow alleyways
She got lost in the warren of market stalls
Senator Warren proposed new financial regulations
The Warren Commission investigated Kennedy's assassination

definitions: capital and largest city of Poland, located on the Vistula River
examples: Warsaw was rebuilt after World War II destruction
The Warsaw Uprising memorial honors resistance fighters
Business travelers fly frequently between Warsaw and Berlin
Warsaw's Old Town is a UNESCO World Heritage site

definitions: capital city of the United States, formally Washington, D.C.
state in the Pacific Northwest region of the United States
George Washington, first president and founding father of the United States
examples: Politicians debate policy in Washington
The Washington Monument dominates the capital skyline
Washington state produces abundant apples and wine
Seattle is the largest city in Washington
Washington led the Continental Army to victory
Washington's farewell address warned against political parties
